title: Baphomet
html:
Baphomet

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Baphomet is a demon lord that appears within Gehennom in dNetHack, EvilHack, SpliceHack-Rewrite, and Hack'EM, with his role differing depending on the variant.

Description

& Baphomet
Difficulty 32
Attacks Butt 3d10 physical, Bearhug 3d8 physical, Weapon 3d6 physical, Breath weapon 5d12 acid
& Baphomet
Difficulty 32
Attacks

Butt 3d10 physical, Bearhug 3d8 physical, Weapon 3d6 physical, Breath weapon 5d12 acid

Base level 56
Base experience 4421
Speed 14
Base AC -15
Base MR 80
Alignment -15 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 500
Size huge
Resistances fire, poison, acid

Baphomet:

  • can swim.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is a giant.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.
  • waits for you to come.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor, the Bell of Opening, the Book of the Dead, the Candelabrum of Invocation, and your quest artifact.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • may turn against you when tame.
  • cannot be tamed.

Generation

Baphomet is one of the five demon lords whose lair can appear as the first level of the Abyss. On generation of Baphomet's level, he is placed within one of the two spectator booths at the northernmost or southernmost ends of the arena structure if he has not already appeared in a game.

Baphomet can be gated in by other major demons and demon rulers, with some specific rules pertaining to him:

  • The first demon lord Pale Night gates in will always be Baphomet if he has not yet appeared.
  • Yeenoghu is a rival demon lord, and so will never gate in Baphomet (though the pair do not grudge each other).

Baphomet will always be generated with three scrolls of magic mapping and Heartcleaver, a chaotic and intelligent artifact weapon whose base item is a halberd - it can be used in melee combat, and grants its wielder +1 to-hit and double damage.

Details

Baphomet has four attacks: a 3d10 headbutt, a 3d8 bearhug, a 3d6 weapon attack, and acidic breath that can deal 5d12 damage.

Like most demon rulers, Baphomet is capable of gating in other demons and demon rulers: the first demon lord Baphomet gates in will always be Pale Night if it has not yet appeared, and he will never gate in Yeenoghu.

Seeing Baphomet directly will permanently inflict the rage madness upon you, reducing your AC and spellcasting rates while increasing the damage you deal.

Strategy

Baphomet is a melee specialist, but isn't particularly threatening to an ascension-ready character. Depending on his location in the arena relative to the stairs (which have six possible locations), he can difficult to avoid for those trying to slip past without a fight; his level will also be full of his servant minotaurs and minotaur priestesses, and Baphomet himself also counts as a minotaur.

It may be possible depending on the layout to dig out a path that allows you to get the jump on Baphomet, then read a non-cursed scroll of earth before he can warp to your position.

Generation

Baphomet is one of the four first-tier demon lords whose lair can appear in Gehennom. He can also be gated in by other major demons.

Baphomet will always generate with a bardiche that has the venom object property.

Encyclopedia entry

This hulking, manlike brute stands 20 feet tall. His muscular
frame is covered in thick, matted black hair. His head is that
of a fiendish bull, and his great horns are stained in the
lifeblood of countless victims.
[ Hordes of the Abyss, by Ed Stark,
James Jacobs, and Erik Mona ]

rawPage:
'''Baphomet''' is a [[demon lord]] that appears within [[Gehennom]] in [[dNetHack]], [[EvilHack]], [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]], and [[Hack'EM]], with his role differing depending on the variant.

==Description==

===Generation===
Baphomet is one of the five demon lords whose lair can appear as the first level of the Abyss. On generation of [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Lord_Levels#Baphomet.2C Demon Lord of Mazes and Minotaurs|Baphomet's level]], he is placed within one of the two spectator booths at the northernmost or southernmost ends of the arena structure if he has not already appeared in a game.

Baphomet can be [[Demon gating|gated in]] by other major demons and demon rulers, with some specific rules pertaining to him:

* The first demon lord [[Pale Night]] gates in will always be Baphomet if he has not yet appeared.
* [[Yeenoghu]] is a rival demon lord, and so will never gate in Baphomet (though the pair do not [[grudge]] each other).

Baphomet will always be generated with three scrolls of {{? of|magic mapping}} and Heartcleaver, a [[chaotic]] and [[intelligent]] [[artifact weapon]] whose [[base item]] is a halberd - it can be used in melee combat, and grants its wielder +1 [[to-hit]] and [[double damage]].

===Details===
Baphomet has four attacks: a 3d10 headbutt, a 3d8 bearhug, a 3d6 weapon attack, and [[acid]]ic [[Breath weapon|breath]] that can deal 5d12 damage.

Like most demon rulers, Baphomet is capable of gating in other demons and demon rulers: the first demon lord Baphomet gates in will always be [[Pale Night]] if it has not yet appeared, and he will never gate in Yeenoghu.

Seeing Baphomet directly will permanently inflict the rage [[madness]] upon [[you]], reducing your [[AC]] and [[spellcasting]] rates while increasing the damage you deal.

===Strategy===
Baphomet is a melee specialist, but isn't particularly threatening to an ascension-ready character. Depending on his location in the arena relative to the stairs (which have six possible locations), he can difficult to avoid for those trying to slip past without a fight; his level will also be full of his servant [[minotaur]]s and [[minotaur priestess]]es, and Baphomet himself also counts as a minotaur.

It may be possible depending on the layout to dig out a path that allows you to get the jump on Baphomet, then read a non-cursed [[scroll of earth]] before he can warp to your position.
